definition: imperial canopy (e.g. domed umbrella-like roof over carriage)/aureole/halo
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

sentences.english: Talented he, will in the imperial examinations in gun fired?
sentences.chinese: 才華蓋世的他，會在科舉考試中一炮打響嗎？

sentences.english: So, the emperor is on the march under the canopy of Wealthy up.
sentences.chinese: 這麼着，皇帝就在那個富麗的華蓋下游行起來了。

sentences.english: These blankets are made up of gossamer threads spun by juvenile money spiders as they make the big step of leaving home.
sentences.chinese: 這些織物是華蓋蛛幼蛛爲了離開家由蛛絲製造的。

sentences.english: The green canopy serves as a cool shelter during the sweltering summer.
sentences.chinese: 在悶熱的夏天，綠色的華蓋就像一個涼棚。

definition: joined as a string of pearls/in rapid succession/alignment/Renju, a Japanese game, also called Gomoku or five-in-a-row
outstanding people/water and fire (in Daoist writing)
baleful look/inauspicious influence/(of a tire, balloon etc) to leak air
to vent one's anger on (an innocent party)/to take it out on (sb)
luan and phoenix/husband and wife/virtuous person/sovereign/belle
name of "roof" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 40)/see also 宀[mian2]

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
rotating disk/wheel/rotor/cycle of reincarnation in Buddhism
